thread.title: Would You Spend $3,000 On LeBron’s New Shoes?
thread.title_full: Would You Spend $3,000 On LeBron’s New Shoes?

author: Tyler Daswick
title: Would You Spend $3,000 On LeBron’s New Shoes?
text:
Privacy Policy | About Us The Shoes 
I think if we’re lumping anything in with a Looney Tunes aesthetic, it’s not worth $2,000. Sorry, LeBron. The Box 
This is the best-case scenario when someone sees this shoebox in your house: 
Friend: “Is that shoebox made of wood?” 
You: “Yes, it’s made out of the court at Quicken Loans Arena.” 
Friend: [long silence] 
You: “That’s where LeBron and the Cavs won the championship.” 
Friend: “Oh! Yeah that’s cool man.” 
Not a $2,000 conversation. The Ring 
Unequivocally, no. This is corny. The ring isn’t even made out of real gold and diamonds, which would actually make the exorbitant price tag a much better bargain. Instead, it’s made from durilium metal and cubic zircon. Like items at the pharmacy, ingredients on a Cheetos bag, and protein supplements from Eastern Europe, purchases of things you can’t pronounce is not a good idea, and not worth $2,000. All together though? 
Look, the one thing you’re going to use from this box is the shoes, and they’re just not cool enough to warrant dropping a couple Gs. For some sleeker shoe suggestions, check out the best basketball shoes for men .
